incident response policy

Yes. Danfe Corp's incident response program is documented in an internal document titled Playbook - Security and Privacy Incident Response Plan. The response plan includes steps for initiating the response plan, escalation, information gathering, engaging external resources, investigation, analysis, mitigation, restoration, notifications if necessary, and post-mortem.
 
Danfe Corp takes all reports of security-related issues very seriously, In the course of running the Danfe Corp service, we have used this response plan in the past, such as when a user contacts Danfe Corp support with a specific concern about the security of their account. Those investigations largely found end-user actions leading to an undesired situation (e.g. disgruntled employees, use of personal accounts for work, etc). Danfe Corp uses every incident to refine our response process and improve our overall security posture and to adapt to a changing threat landscape.
 
Danfe Corp monitors and quantifies the types, volumes, and impacts of incidents/findings related to security as part of our information security program. Also, they are reviewed during monthly security meetings.

access control

No Answer Available. Danfe Corp maintains internal acceptable use policies and role-specific training. Danfe Corp utilizes role-based access control and the principle of least privilege for granting access. When new employees are added or when existing employees change roles, the employee's role determines which systems they are granted access to and at what access level. Access privileges are reviewed at least yearly and when an employee changes roles or status. Danfe Corp follows an industry-standard practice for cloud SaaS providers by using a multi-tenant database, where software (as opposed to hardware) isolates customer data. Data is isolated by logical privilege-based access controls to prevent unauthorized access. Additionally, customer data is confined in application server process memory and all access to that process is limited to only authorized clients.

According to section 11, personal data is retained only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law.

Therefore, inactive constituent user IDs should be securely deleted or anonymized..
